result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian A Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Jail time if revoked, to run consecutive to any other sentence.
Concurrent with: current sentence

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge on count 5 only.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family) expect through consent of the victim and the agent. Comply with family court order. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Not allowed in a bar.

Imposed and Stayed. Jail time if revoked, to run consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to count 6.
Concurrent with: current sentence & count 5

No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Not allowed in a bar.

DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

Defendant Christian A Lopez in court with attorney Anthony Jackson. Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 5 & count 6; DRI the balance.
Rights Given
P- Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt as to count 5 & count 6; DRI the balance.

Count 5 - 90 days Racine County Jail, i/s, 18 months probation, to run concurrent to Milwaukee County Probation

Count 6 - 90 days Racine County Jail, i/s, 18 months probation, to run concurrent to Milwaukee County Probation

Conditions:
Jail time if revoked to run consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to count 6
No contact with the victim except through the consent of the victim and the agent
Continue in counseling
No alcohol - Not allowed in any bars
Comply with family court order
$500 fine on each count + court costs
Provide DNA Sample + pay surcharge on count 5 only
Eligible for expungement upon successfully completion of probation

Defendant Christian A Lopez in court with attorney Anthony Jackson.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Jamie McClendon
Preliminary hearing on May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, KC (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Christian A Lopez in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Christian A Lopez in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. BTC: WARRANT VACATED  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
